definitions.definition: To cast (an image or shadow) upon a surface; to throw or cast forward; to shoot forth.
To extend (a protrusion or appendage) outward.
To make plans for; to forecast.
definitions.example: The CEO is projecting the completion of the acquisition by April 2007.

definitions.definition: To present (oneself), to convey a certain impression, usually in a good way.
To assume qualities or mindsets in others based on one's own personality.
To change the projection (or coordinate system) of spatial data with another projection.
To draw straight lines from a fixed point through every point of any body or figure, and let these fall upon a surface so as to form the points of a new figure.
The act by which something is projected.

definitions.example: I caught and tore my coat on the projecting nail.

definitions.definition: Giving an outward appearance, in order to avoid a direct connection or to disguise or inflate the real essence.
